con:soapui-project.name: REST Sample Project
con:soapui-project.con:description: Sample Projects bases on a virtualized REST service. Please make sure that port 8084 is available on your local machine or you can update the virtual API under the serviceV tool to reflect an open port on your system. You will also have to update the ports on the tests to reflect the same ports on the virtual service.

con:testCase.name: Simple Login Call
con:testCase.con:description:
Simple test can be used to show how easy it is to call a simple REST Service. You can have one or multiple REST endpoints that are not related to each other. This is commonly used when running integration tests.
Steps: First step turns on Virtual REST Service Second step makes the Login call to the virtual Service and validates that you get a "200 OK" status code Third Step turns off the virtual REST Service
NOTE: If you would like to run the Login step without as a standalone step please turn on the virtual service under the ReadyAPI Virtualization Tool

con:testCase.name: Integration Test
con:testCase.con:description:
Integration tests are supposed to show how APIs work in a real world scenarios, integrating APIs together as a user would use an application in a workflow. In the following example we Login, Search for an Item, Buy the Item and then logout. We have strung these steps together with some of the tools easy to use feature (GET DATA: See Documentation) which allows you to easily pass values from a response to the next request.
Steps: First step turns on Virtual REST Service Second step makes the Login call to the virtual Service and validates that it contains a "session id" json element in the response Third step picks up the session id that was generated in the first step and searches for an Item ID. The response is also validated for a "200 OK" Status code Fourth step picks up the session id from the second step and the item from the third step's response. We validate the response to match the item that was searched for on the third step. Fifth Step turns off the virtual REST Service
NOTE: If you would like to run the Login step without as a standalone step please turn on the virtual service under the ReadyAPI Virtualization Tool

con:assertion.name: Match content of [Successfully logged out session]

con:testCase.name: DataDriven REST Test
con:testCase.con:description:
Datadriven test help test a scenario where the same or multiple APIs need to be tested with a large amount of data inputs, it can also be used to test a large dataset of expected results through assertions. These data inputs can be picked up from a Database, Excel spread sheet and many other data entities.
Steps: First step turns on Virtual REST Service Second step makes the Login call to the virtual Service and validates that it contains a "session id" json element in the response Third step picks up the session id from the second step and passes it into the request input parameters. We validate the response for "200 OK" status code. Fifth Step turns off the virtual REST Service
NOTE: If you would like to run the Login step without as a standalone step please turn on the virtual service under the ReadyAPI Virtualization Tool NOTE: Check the Test Case transaction log after the execution of the test to view every single requet and response
